website_summaries.verdict: A truly waterproof winter glove that keeps fingers warm and dry. The tight wrist strap keeps snow out and heat in.
pros: Fingers are well-insulated, no need for additional liner gloves
Durable outer shell resists damage from shovels and other tools
Very affordable price point for the quality
cons: Not suitable for regions with extremely cold weather
Narrow wrist, challenging to put on

customer_reviews.title: Water-resistant at best
customer_reviews.text: Stayed dry for all of 30 minutes then it started absorbing water. So i have 4 hours left on my shift, I work outdoors, it is raining, it is just barely above freezing, and i have no other gloves. I am disappointed to say the least
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I like the gloves but this is unacceptable
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are 4 months old. The seam on the outside of the palm split. I want a refund. I like the gloves but this is unacceptable!
customer_reviews.author: York Taenzer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely need more quality control
customer_reviews.text: When I first received this pair of gloves, I was pretty happy about how it fited and the fabric quality. However, I noticed there was a edge on the finger that have no stitches over it, so water or snow could easily go into my gloves. I might have received a lemon. I am returning this pair and order another pair to give it a shot. I'll update this review after I receive the new pair.
customer_reviews.author: Zhe Wang

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit to squeeze hands through
customer_reviews.text: Just got delivered and hand will not go in without struggling through the wrist on gloves. I can't put both of them on by myself. Once they're on hand fitment is good. Don't know how they'll hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Size up at least one size
customer_reviews.text: Well enough constructed for the price but if you're attracted to these gloves, be careful in regard to sizing. I have construction sized large hands and due to Chinas sizing practices I ordered X-large to cover the sizing difference. Didn't work, had to return and reorder for XX-Large. It's not as if up-sizing needs to be considered due to layering, Still a little snug, have to release the adjusting strap to its largest setting. I have recently purchased Carhartt's button down long sleeve undershirts along with a new winter coat and the quality is as usual, unquestionable. As are these gloves, except for the sizing. Be considerate of it.
customer_reviews.author: Wrench

customer_reviews.title: Displeased
customer_reviews.text: I live in Minnesota. these gloves have not kept my hands warm at all. they retain moisture like a sponge, and that makes it (the cold) even worse. also, the lining is very loose, and they are simply uncomfortable. I would not buy theses gloves again. Carhartt has not kept up the quality I expect from them, even their work pants have much poorer quality than in previous years. VERY DISSAPOINTED!
customer_reviews.author: Zombienkongen

customer_reviews.title: i never saw anyting like it in my life
customer_reviews.text: could not get them to dry. took almost 2 weeks for them to dry. i never saw anyting like it in my life. i had them on a radiator too. they are deff water proof and i the moisture inside must have been from my hand sweat. i had to buy another brand of gloves. oh, and they ripped the first day i was using them to shovel as well. the thumb stitch came apart.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher G.

customer_reviews.title: Hubby loves these :)
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted waterproof gloves, so I got these. They fit well and he could move his fingers with them on. We recently had our first snow, so he got to try them out. When he came out of work- his car was covered in snow and he said he had a great time just using his gloves to knock and push snow off of the car, lol. His hands didn't get cold or wet- so these are a winner for us :)
customer_reviews.author: Laura Barnham

customer_reviews.title: Good for show, not for skiing or work
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give these more than 2 stars...but from a performance standpoint I can’t justify it. If you are looking for a glove to wear around a campfire or while sitting outside or going for a walk, these are great! Any activity that gets them wet (mostly by sweat) they become useless. Pros: very well made nice looking glove, great fit, nice and warm when idle or casually walking around, mostly waterproof until they get wet inside, good in wind (when dry), warm in single digit temps. Cons: retain water like crazy, don’t dry well, smell bad after a few uses (this is directly related to them not being able to dry out at night.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES

customer_reviews.title: Exactly As Described: Warm, Insulated And Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: These gloves arrived after we had two snowfalls and the temperature was zero in the morning and never rose above twenty. Put these gloves on (I ordered them in small, medium and large - one for me, one for husband and one for friend) and set to work de-icing, de-snowing my truck. Ahhh bliss. My hands were finally warm. The gloves are bulky but flexible enough to hold scrapers, shovels, etc. without awkwardness. The cuffs are elasticized, but not too tight. Kept the snow from getting in. Outer layer didn't get wet. All in all, these gloves are exactly as described: warm, insulated and waterproof. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: VW

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: Carhartt makes the best winter coats and winter hoods. I gave Carhartt gloves a scathing review, however it dawned on me that I kept taking my gloves off to do work in the snow, then blamed Carhartt gloves for not keeping my hands warm. If you keep your gloves on they will keep your hands warm, my apologies to Carhatt.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Medium label, small size
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these gloves using the Amazon sizing criteria. When received, they were labelled as the size I ordered...medium. However, I couldn't get my hand in the glove...neither could my wife (who has small hands). I have no idea how these gloves were sized, or if they were mislabeled. What I do know is the gloves were way too small. So, back to Amazon. I wanted to return for a larger size, but the tan/black gloves were not available. They do seem to be well made and I wish they had fit. The two stars are due to the size problem...if they had been labeled correctly and fit, they would have gotten 4 or 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Leroy Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Best gloves ever!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! My fingers are usually cold even with other regular gloves. These kept my fingers toasty in snowy weather! They are for men but I still got them in size Small. Tightening buckle works great for extra fit. They are a little bulky but I don't care what they look like cuz my hands are so comfy while I'm out with my boys playing in the snow!
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Hand Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are excellent they are warm against cold windy days they have a tight fit and also I like the side hook attachment so I can hook the gloves together makes it easier not to lose one glove I highly recommend these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: AlanWarner

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Just... wow!!!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are amazing. I ordered th XXL. I have very large hands. Finding gloves that fit me... is a difficult task. Nearly impossible. Well... these fit me perfectly! They are tight... but just right. Perfect fit. They are so soft on the inside but seem really durable. I did submerge test them in the sink... held my hands in there for over a minute. Not one leak. So far these seem like the perfect gloves! I’m so excited for winter now. I’m ready to break out the gloves and go at it with the snowblower. I’m as anxious as a nun in a cucumber patch! Thank you!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Infandous Ktenology

customer_reviews.title: Not completely waterproof, but great for regular use
customer_reviews.text: Not completely waterproof. In regular, non-immersed use, they're great. If you have to use these immersed up to your knuckles for short periods, water will come through the seams after a minute or two. I use these in the winter to clean out duck watering bowls, and quick dips in the bowl are fine, but a minute in the water up to my knuckles ends up with water inside the glove. These are very warm (when dry) and excellent for use in rain and snow. Not useable on smartphone screens.
customer_reviews.author: Clarence D. Marshall Jr.

customer_reviews.title: SIZING IS WAY OFF!!! XL smaller than the Large?!?!? Perfect if you have short stubby fingers, though!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the men's size Large for my husband for Christmas. When I tried them on, I was discouraged to find that they fit my petite 5'1" lady hands perfectly. I'm small and have short fingers...so exactly WHY am I fitting perfectly into a MEN'S LARGE?? Hubs is 6' and has proportionately sized fingers. He tried the gloves on and of course they were too small. I exchanged them for an XL and this pair was even SMALLER than the size Large! I guess Carhartt only makes gloves for people with super short fingers. I'm going to have to find another brand. How annoying, because they seemed well made and very warm otherwise. Would've been perfect for a Wisconsin winter.
customer_reviews.author: Lip Gloss Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Too warm; hard to dry lining
customer_reviews.text: Not crazy about these gloves. They're definitely warm; too warm for 40 degree Oregon weather. Bulky and impossible to do small tasks like click the button on my car key. Worst is that the lining is a separate layer of material that is spot sown into the outer nylon layer. When the inner layer gets wet from sweat they become hard to remove and almost impossible to put back on. It takes an overnight on the heat grate to get them dry again. Inner liner is not removable. Maybe useful to some people in snow and very cold temps but I'm still searching for a Thinsulate pair like my old worn-out gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Toripony

customer_reviews.title: Very small entry point
customer_reviews.text: Wow I usually wear medium to large in every glove with medium being a little tight but absolutely manageable. These Carhartt gloves are extremely small. I can’t even get my hand into the glove. The entry point that is suppose to tighten around the wrist is too small to fit my hand into the glove. The fingers look like the right size but unless you have a very slender hand these will not fit. The odd part about all of this is the wrist tightening strap is very big to compensate for small wrists but honestly this looks like a mans glove with a little kids wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Ultrajuice

customer_reviews.title: Warm, rugged, and waterproof
customer_reviews.text: These are probably the best winter gloves I've ever purchased. They are nice and long, extending to cover your entire wrist (and up your forearm a bit) to keep snow and other debris out. They seem totally waterproof so far, and they are nice and warm too. As with most Carhartt gear, these gloves aren't exactly form-fitting of course. Manipulating small dials or knobs will be a bit of a challenge, but most wintery tasks like starting a snowblower, shoveling, and clearing your car are totally doable with these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: William Brendel

customer_reviews.title: ORDER A SIZE LARGER THAN YOU NORMALLY WEAR!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have heard such great praise for Carhartt clothing (jackets, coats, pants, overalls, and coveralls) that I thought these wou would be GREAT gloves? Pro's: they do a good job of keeping my hands warm and dry. Con's: ORDER A SIZE LARGER THAN YOU NORMALLY WEAR!!! My hands are Large and I had to FIGHT with these gloves in order to get them on, and it was even worse after putting one glove on and give a mighty struggle to get the other glove on! The liner is so loose in the gloves that the liner scrunches up as I slide my hands up inside the gloves! They should glue the liner to the inside of the outer shell!
customer_reviews.author: QBall to Y'all

customer_reviews.title: Very small.
customer_reviews.text: XXL??? These gloves wouldn't fit a T-Rex!! I can't get my hands inside them!
customer_reviews.author: David Ouellette

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh... not great.
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT waterproof! What a joke. I snowblow with them (I really need to find better ones), and water does permeate the outer material. And... my hands freeze in them. I don't get it... I figured these would have been awesome, but they're not. They also don't fit really well... as my hands get a bit moist, I can barely put them back on as the inner lining doesn't cooperate : )
customer_reviews.author: DavidS

customer_reviews.title: Palms and fingers not grippy at all. Smooth and slippery. Hard to get on.
customer_reviews.text: Really hard to get on especially with the stretch fleece cuff. Once you manage to get one on, the second is near impossible without help because you can't grab it with your other glove. Palm and fingers are too smooth and slippery to grip tools securely. I ride a motorcycle and they didnt feel secure enough because of lack of grippyness. So definately not the glove for me. Didn't test them anymore than that so can't comment on warmth, waterproofness or wear.
customer_reviews.author: alko

customer_reviews.title: Durable and well-insulated
customer_reviews.text: Got these gloves for my son, who works as a restaurant dishwasher. One of the chores associated with the job is the daily trash run, which can be a cold, wet affair during fall and winter months and is always hard on his hands, regardless of the weather. He loves these gloves. They stand up to the job with no sign of wear, are comfortable, and they keep his hands warm in nasty weather.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn165

customer_reviews.title: Water proof-ish
customer_reviews.text: These are a great value. They are not a fine outdoor gear. They are warm work gloves. When the insulation in leather work gloves isn’t enough these take over nicely. The insulation is thick enough that dexterity is poor but this is true of basically all warm gloves. They are water resistant enough that your hands don’t get wet working in spring snow for a bit but they will absolutely soak through after an hour or two. Perfect for shoveling wet snow.
customer_reviews.author: MedIT

customer_reviews.title: Prior to this my hands would feel like they were being chewed on by the frozen teeth ...
customer_reviews.text: Prior to this my hands would feel like they were being chewed on by the frozen teeth of white walkers north of the wall in Game of Thrones. Thankfully I bought these uber toasty gloves! Wow. Nice comfy fit and great for my bike ride into work during brutally cold New England winter mornings and evenings. If Carhartt works for those who are outside all day, they should work for you. Plus they look kind of like Darth Vader gloves which is a bonus. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: marco athie

customer_reviews.title: Not as warm as you would think
customer_reviews.text: I was out in 32 degree weather and my fingertips stayed very cold. not for being outside in the cold for a long time plus if it's a little warmer out and your hands begin to sweat the glove gets wet inside. would not buy again. I was thinking Carhartt Men's W.P. Waterproof Insulated Gloves would be better because of the name. also if you do get these size up on them the opening has a band around them that's real tight to get by.
customer_reviews.author: Sig Sauer

customer_reviews.title: THESE ARE LEGIT!! Cold fingers be gone
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I'm so glad I bought these gloves. They are insulated inside so you dont need to wear thin inner gloves like with other snow gloves. Ive always had a problem with cold fingers when I ski so I've always been iffy about going up to the mountain but now that I have these gloves I'm ready to go because I know my fingers will stay warm. Sometimes it gets a little too warm and my hands get sweaty but I'll take that over numb fingers any day. Its even better that these are cheaper than Armada gloves or ski name brand gloves and they work just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Ho

customer_reviews.title: I bought a large pair for myself but I have a super hard time to get my hands fit in it
customer_reviews.text: It is a pair of decent gloves and do they work. They are definitely water proof and its promised keep you warm in the most cold weather. The reason I am giving it a three star is because of its inside design. I bought a large pair for myself but I have a super hard time to get my hands fit in it. Once after a huge struggle my hands are in, these gloves limit my finger movement. Suppose I am cleaning snow with a shovel I will discomfort grabbing onto the handle because of the limitation of the range of motion. Overall it wasn't too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Jabiraj1

customer_reviews.title: Will keep your hands very warm.
customer_reviews.text: Very warm and comfortable gloves. Just don't think your going do anything with them on. You can't. They are for walking or sitting in the cold. They are thick. I bought them to use when I drive my Honda pioneer 1000 in the cold. Even the wind couldn't make my hands cold but they just made it difficult to steer. I'm going to break them in and try it again. They are very warm. I really want them to work.
customer_reviews.author: betty j goad

customer_reviews.title: Top quality.  Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: I only have large hands, and I accidentally didn't see the XX in the description (I'm pretty sure the Amazon link landed me on the wrong XX page when I hit the back button on my browser), but I'm so glad that I got this huge size as they are roomy but they cover my forearms. They quality is out-of-this-world good. These will last decades. My fingers do sweat a bit because they really are waterproof, but I expected that.
customer_reviews.author: Cool Joe

customer_reviews.title: Carhartt makes good quality products
customer_reviews.text: Carhartt makes good quality products in my experience and these gloves saw me through many hours of snow removal since I purchased them and keep my hands warm and dry. They are extremely soft on inside which is a bit weird from what I'm use to but would recommend them to family and friends. Great gloves. At 5"10" and 200lbs I went with extra Large and had enough room to pillow body heat. Great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Brother Greg

customer_reviews.title: decent gloves
customer_reviews.text: First of all, these are not work gloves, those who use them as such need to order work gloves.... I ride a motorcycle, a lot. Rode my bike to work this morning, is 32 degrees out. Yes my hands were still cold, but not unbearably cold, they were better than usual. The size runs a little small, I wear an extra large so that's what I ordered, could probably wear a 2x a little more comfortable. The size isn't enough to return them, I may order a larger set though. They are comfy, reasonably warm, and inexpensive, but don't expect them to be anything more than $20 gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves, good value, run a bit small
customer_reviews.text: After striking out with some cheaper gloves that claimed to be rated for -10 degrees but were useless at +20, I gave these a shot. Very happy I did. They have kept my hands dry and warm during a cold January. One star off for a running a bit small. I don't have giant hands, but the large is pretty snug. You might want to try a couple sizes if you aren't sure. Also, my fingertips did get a little cold in near zero temps, but I'm not too surprised or disappointed by that. I also bought a pair of the Carhartt W.P. Waterproof Insulated mittens for crazy cold. All in all I recommend these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C.

customer_reviews.title: -15 and still warm
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my boyfriend who is currently in Gillette Wyoming working and the temperature is -6 and feels like -15 and he is just so happy his hands are nice and warm with these gloves. Everytime we talk he mentions how good these gloves are and told me to make sure I leave a good review. He isn't just shoveling snow for 5 minutes either, he is a flow back operator so he is out in the elements for long periods of time. I'm only going off of what he says, and we are from South Louisiana so if he is warm and happy at -15 degrees than so am I!!
customer_reviews.author: Marion Cuyler

customer_reviews.title: Not For Work
customer_reviews.text: These gloves will definitely keep your hands warm BUT they are definitely not construction-type gloves. After three days of climbing on and off equipment, shoveling, raking, moving pipe, etc. I have worn through the left glove already. As for them being waterproof, the gloves hold water but I’m assuming that with the liner on the inside it never gets to my hands. I expected a bit more durability from Carhartt.
customer_reviews.author: Les

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof and warm
customer_reviews.text: Very warm and waterproof. If your hands are sweaty when you take them off the inside likes to pull out at the fingers making putting them back on a little of a chore. And the cuffs don’t have any rigidity to them so once one glove is on the second glove’s cuff doesn’t come up quite as good as the first. Not a lot of fine finger ability due to the puffiness but the goal is warm and dry and they deliver on that.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Kowalski

customer_reviews.title: Warmest gloves I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Very, very warm! Driving a UTV in cold weather is miserable. These keeps my hands very warm. The only downside (and to be expected with this level of insulation) is I have to take them off to work with nuts/bolts and small objects like that. I usually wear a thinner pair of work gloves under them just to have something on my hands when handling small parts
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Poor design, especially for Carhartt
customer_reviews.text: They're pretty warm and water resistant enough, but the lining is crap. It's a loose fleece and once your hands are damp it's almost impossible to get them back into the glove. Considering that you're usually using these gloves in wet conditions, that's terrible. Plus it's tight around the wrist. I ended up cutting the putter fleece sleeve off and I'd recommend buying them 1 size larger to help mitigate the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Randall - Absolute Veteran

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Junk don't waste your money! These shredded while starting a snow blower!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get on
customer_reviews.text: I bought a large and it fits my hand perfectly buts its a big struggle to get on because the opening is too tight which makes no sense as it has an adjustable strap. Then when out in the snow I just gave up once it became slippery it was impossible! This is not a size problem its a design problem, Wasted my money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Carhartt has disappointed me
customer_reviews.text: Long story short. These are in NO WAY work gloves! Lining is so soft and loose they lose all their gripping ability! Snow boarding, skiing, riding ATVs; sure, go ahead. Serious work? Forget it! They'll make your job a lot harder. And considering I was unable to pick up a 3-6 inch log securely in one hand; I actually believe they are a safety hazard. NOTE: They fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Super warm
customer_reviews.text: Super warm. I was shoveling snow when the Amazon vehicle brought these. I had on relatively thick gloves, but my hands were cold in the 10 degrees weather. I switched into these, and after about ten minutes, my fingers were get warm, and I finished the driveway without a warm up break. I am 5'5" and 106# with average size, slightly longer fingers hands and these are size medium, and fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Mary F.

customer_reviews.title: Not a work glove
customer_reviews.text: First I love Carhart brand. Usually the work clothes a high quality. So I needed insulated work gloves. I am not happy with these. They are bulky and definitely not water proof. The insulation is so so. My hands still get cold. I need gloves that fit well and I can feel and pick up a small screw. I can not do this with these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: J S

customer_reviews.title: Soft and warm
customer_reviews.text: We recently got 30 inches of snow in my neck of the woods, and my husband was in need of some gloves for shoveling and snow blowing. He picked these. They seem to be good quality, are nice and soft on the inside, and kept his hands warm while he was digging us out (for 2 days) .... I dont know how well they will hold up, but we will see.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffani

customer_reviews.title: definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves. Wear them everday while riding my dirtbike in 20-30 degree weather and keep my hands warm and dry. Also wore them snow boarding and worked awesome. Got a small tear in very outter grip lining after a couple months but i put them thru hell snowboarding and they still work great even with the small tear. These work better than the $50 gloves i bought at same time!
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Leinenbach

customer_reviews.title: Gift for my husband
customer_reviews.text: These gloves were a gift for my husband. He loves them and says that they are great quality and kept his hands very warm. He only uses them for shoveling snow, clearing snow off the cars, and taking the dog out. So, it's not like he uses them for farm work, that would require actual work gloves. The only complaint my husband had was that there is a thin scrunchy part right around the wrist (just below the fleece cuff) that he has a really hard time trying to get his hand past (and the strap has been loosened all the way) but once he gets his hand passed it, the rest of the glove fits great.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: My son is 18 and very tall and very thin. It's hard to find things that fit him and keep him warm during his active outdoor life in our Minnesota Winters. He lost his gloves a couple of weeks back and I ordered these. He said they are fantastic and fit really well. They keep his hands warm even during extended periods of sub-zero temps. He is really happy with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: M. Merchant

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Just had pretty big snow storm and temps in the high teens to low 20's. These are great. They are soft inside, comfortable, very warm and good function, good finger dexterity though you wont be able to thread a fish hook:) I play hard and they have shown no wear after several days of shoveling, snow ball fights, ATV riding ,and just all around fun.They look good also. Another product assuring my place in the Carhartt fan club.
customer_reviews.author: j rocket

customer_reviews.title: Very small, one size fits all.
customer_reviews.text: They seem to very good. I have a small hand and they told me they were one size fit all. They told me to keep them. And never refunded me my purchase price afterall.
customer_reviews.author: 5itemsorless

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust them
customer_reviews.text: Highly disappointed.. they are really warm and padded but I can't give them anything more than 2 stars. They are like wearing warm pillows and your fingers are almost useless.. why even have finger cuts when you can't use them. Also if you take them off when it's snowing good luck trying to put them back on.. almost impossible to get them back on if your hands are wet from snow. Update: changed from two stars to one because of these things do not keep your fingers warm. after clearing snow for just 15 minutes outside I can't feel my fingertips and have to go back in. Never buying a Carhartt product again.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Worthless...
customer_reviews.text: In 17 degree weather...MY HANDS FROZE! While shoveling snow, within 15 minutes I could feel the numbness in my fingertips. I have a closet full of Carhartt outdoor clothing that I swear by, but these gloves are truly WORTHLESS. Look somewhere else for gloves!
customer_reviews.author: FrankieG

customer_reviews.title: Runs small, inner lining is loose, waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: The gloves were smaller than expected. They were waterproof, but also not breathable, so by the end of the day my hands were soaked with sweat, so they ended up cold anyway. The inner lining was really soft, but not attached well to the outer lining so the fingers never lined up. I was constantly finding myself struggling for several minutes to get the gloves on. Once in place though, they felt comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: william arnold

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: I personally do not recommend these gloves. After using to shovel and use snow blower the inside thermal lining becomes damp. They won't dry out and they started to smell. In addition they started to tear along the thumb and first finger. All of this was an unpleasant surprise with a Carhartt product. I only used them a few times but have decided to just use lighter grade (less bulky) gloves to do my business outside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves
customer_reviews.text: My husband says he would give these 10 stars (maybe just because I bought them for him). No really they are great gloves and he wears them all the time especially now since this cold spell has swept across the country. They kept his hands nice and warm in windy 9 degree weather. January 5,2017
customer_reviews.author: Chavala

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size XXL, couldn’t get my hand in it. Gave them to a friend that usually wears size large gloves, they fit, but were tight. Total waste of time and money!! I expect this from the cheap box store brands, but not Carhart. Guess I’ll be checking out Dickies or another brand next time I need something for work.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: great glove for the price
customer_reviews.text: feels nice and durable on the outside, and keeps my hands nice and warm on the inside. I bought these just as "Normal" gloves to wear to keep my hands warm. But for the price i would not mind buying another pair to use as work gloves when it gets cold. As far as waterproof I do not know as I have not tested that yet. I did not give this 5 stars because they did not fit my hands completely... But I have HUGE hands and wear either 2XL or 3XL gloves (depends on how big the gloves are, as no two manufactures seen to make a 2XL or 3XL exactly the same)
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Too bad glove is too tight.
customer_reviews.text: The quality and design of this glove is excellent, unfortunately in my opinion the size is mislabeled. I usually wear a large or extra large glove size. I ordered the XXL size to be sure of a comfortable fit. I was surprised that I could barely get my hand into it. It’s too tight. I regret buying it. Otherwise I would give it a five.
customer_reviews.author: PICKLES

customer_reviews.title: Useless Winter Gloves
customer_reviews.text: One star at best. I figured Carhartt winter gloves would be well made and thought out but these are not. The slightest amount of moister and the gloves are useless. They do not breath so your hands will sweat and the inside material does not dry out even when you remove the gloves it takes a lot of time for them to dry out. My hands really do not sweat and after 15 minutes of working outside my hands are cold. These gloves are useless, stay away..
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Dry and warm.
customer_reviews.text: I just had a chance to wear these out to shovel snow (1hr) and drive in 13-19 degree weather. Warm and dry as a bone. I thought driving would be an issue in the cold weather losing dexterity but it turned out it wasn't a problem. It provided a nice grip on the steering wheel and didn't notice much of a difference in driving besides the extra grippy feeling. This definitely beats the 9 dollar pair i got from wal mart that said weather insulated..
customer_reviews.author: Wing Tang

customer_reviews.title: Not breathable, but still good gloves.
customer_reviews.text: The fitment of these gloves are spot on. Comfort is great as well. I use these when I'm out clearing snow in the neighborhood with a snowblower. My hands stay nice and toasty. Sometimes too warm and begin to sweat. That's why I gave it 3 stars... They claim to be breathable, but even 2 days later the insides were still damp. Not very breathable in my opinion. But they are warm!
customer_reviews.author: CpBh

customer_reviews.title: careful of sizing.
customer_reviews.text: The issue here is the gloves that fit your hand might have too small a wrist opening to even get your hand in. I almost needed Crisco to slide these on. Once, in, the fingers were perfect. Ended up getting a larger size, but the problem is the fingers are now too big. So, consider that when choosing your size. They are definitely warm gloves for nasty weather!
customer_reviews.author: Strutter '79

customer_reviews.title: Zero manual dexterity
customer_reviews.text: Zero dexterity - nice gloves for certain activities that do not include any kind of mechanical work. Manual dexterity is so poor that I have difficulty putting on the right hand glove once the left hand glove is on. I had to remove the gloves to work with screws, washers, nuts, etc., so if you are a mechanic of any trade be advised that you will be removing at least one glove frequently. However, if you need a good glove for shoveling snow or riding a snowmobile then these are fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bulky gloves, but incredibly warm!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these gloves for my husband who commutes 1.5 hours and a few blocks walk in the frigid Chicago winters. He was overjoyed to receive these and he said his hands were the warmest part of his body. The interior of the gloves are incredibly soft. These are very bulky gloves and one needs to remove them in order to do practically anything. Nonetheless, we are pleased!
customer_reviews.author: A Helpful Mama

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit
customer_reviews.text: Ordered size XL because that is what the size chart on other gloves said to use. These are larger than others so they were too big for me. Unfortunately, I let the return window expire. they are comfortable other than being too big. Can't say anything about warmth.
customer_reviews.author: drdave

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for knock-around gloves and they fit the bill. The longer than normal cuffs are a definite plus. It is now the beginning of January and we haven't had any real cold yet so I don't know how they will do in single digit temps. They fit well and are quite comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Willee

customer_reviews.title: Great glove. Wrist too tight though!
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful. Waterproof, warm, and great build quality. However I give it 4 stars because the sizing is not quite right. Fits my hand perfectly , but the wrist is snug and sometimes I have a hard time getting my wrist through the opening. Once I have them on they are perfect. I understand the snug wrist is there to keep the environment out of the glove, I just wish it were stretchy. I suggest getting one size up just to accommodate for the wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: They are fairly warm but I would not say that they are waterproof. I work at a car dealership and bought these as an upgrade before a big snow storm. I was outside for 6 hours cleaning off and moving cars and these let some water in around the finger tips. Worked about as well as similar gloves I've bought at Walmart for much less.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Probably wouldn't buy them again.
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof is a bit of an exaggeration, water resistant would be a closer approximation. I put on the gloves and after a few hours outside the inner lining was wet. The inner liner also pulls out when you take off the glove, leaving you to find the finger holes the next time you put them on. You are really paying for the name, I would have done just as well for half the price at Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: David Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Great for winter camping
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a winter camping trip. They are kind of thick and bulky to be considered work gloves, but they really kept me warm at night. I used a thinner pair of gloves to set up camp and get everything ready, but they were not waterproof or nearly as warm. Needless to say when the temperature dropped below 20, these were great. They take a while to warm your hands when you first put them on, but after about 10 minutes, your hands should be nice and toasty.
customer_reviews.author: Davidabear

customer_reviews.title: Finally gloves my husband does not complain about!
customer_reviews.text: My husband refuses to go into a store to shop for clothes. He has been that way through 35 years of marriage and he is not going to change. So I play this endless game of shopping for him and bringing home a choice of clothing and accessories he swears were bought by someone out to get him. After 35 years, he finally liked this pair of gloves AND a pair of boots I just bought him! So either he has lost his senses or these gloves are perfect. I am satisfied with either event.😁
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: They are warm and dry and super comfortable. The gloves started to fall apart in ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of these gloves last winter and it was the only pair of gloves I needed all winter. I wore them daily to work. (sawmill) and then I would use them at home for snow blowing and playing outside with my son. These gloves got a real workout and held up fantastically. They are warm and dry and super comfortable. The gloves started to fall apart in early spring when it was getting too warm to wear them. I just purchased another pair for this winter. These gloves are well worth the money. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: James Lertora

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with them
customer_reviews.text: I bought a larger size than I thought I needed. When dry, they fit okay, but as soon as the inner liner got moist they were almost impossible to get on. I guess if you buy a very much larger size than you ordinarily would wear they might be fun. That said, they seemed to be of high quality.
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Happy with these after using them to clear snow in a recent storm. They stayed very warm, and my hands were dry the whole time (at least, they felt dry). However, when using them again the next day, the insides were still damp from the previous day. Despite some reasonable attempts to dry them (putting them in front of the hot air vent for 12 hours), they held on to that moisture pretty well. However, I used them in their damp state anyway, and I still felt warm in them.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn F

customer_reviews.title: No dogs allowed
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves and purchase them once before. However, one of my two German Shepherds decided to shred one of them so I had to place another order. Neither have confessed so both still remain innocent but I think I have a good idea who the culprit is, or do I? All kidding aside, the gloves were good enough to earn another purchase and with a name such as Carhartt, you can't go wrong. They are warm and waterproof, just not Shepherd proof.
customer_reviews.author: jeodee

customer_reviews.title: The recent snow storm aka "Bomb Cyclone" that hit the ...
customer_reviews.text: The recent snow storm aka "Bomb Cyclone" that hit the North East coast in Jan of 2018 left 2 feet of snow in my area (New York) - shovel snow for 3 hours and was wearing the Carhartt W.P Waterproof Insulated gloves. Waterproof was not the problem in fact the waterproof worked as advertised. The problem was at the finger tips of the gloves - my finger tips after 1/2 hour were so cold that I had to go inside to warm them up. Carhartt needs to provide extra insulation at the finger tips to correct this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just buy these gloves. They're all you need.
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves. I work in a freezer that's as cold as -20 degrees and only use this type of gloves. Ive tried a few different brands and these are the only ones that hold up long term. I'm on my second pair now and I put the first pair through a lot. I do everything from lifting freight and pallets to typing on a keyboard with these and I've never had an issue. Not having to word about water seeping through is great too .
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Grillo

customer_reviews.title: Warm but useless,Water Proof ??
customer_reviews.text: Bought on Amazon because of reviews. These gloves soak water like a sponge,so much for water proof!!. I work out doors all day in Oregon,along the Columbia River, these gloves got soaked in 20 minutes,and when you them off they are hard to get back on from the wetness inside that adds resistance to your hand, bunching the liner inside. The insulation also makes it hard to get a good grip on objects because it slips around inside.I will not buy again. Best way is still to oil my old leather gloves,I may get cold hands but at least I can get a better handle on my tools
customer_reviews.author: Dale in Albuquerque

customer_reviews.title: You Need to Get a Pair of These Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves, they keep my hands nice and toasty and dry when I'm blowingthe snow off the driveway. I will mention though, I followed the sizing chart to ordermy size, it said I should be wearing an XL, so that's what I ordered, when they arrived, they were definitly too big, so ordered another pair of Large - PerfitFit. With that said, you might want to think about the size the chart tells you, compared to what size you might normally wear.
customer_reviews.author: COLORADOBOWHUNTER

customer_reviews.title: If you work in cold weather they're worth a try
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes these better than any other pair I've bought him. At times he can work in freezers that are below zero. He said these gloves are so warm his fingers sweat, but he's OK with being too warm as opposed to too cold. I bought him a large and the wrist fit a little small so I ordered another pair in 2x we're keeping the large as an extra pair.
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey

customer_reviews.title: Carhartt Waterproof insulated glove's are hard to beat for Michigan's Winter season.
customer_reviews.text: First of all the name Carhartt say's it all, and as expected this product did what the seller said it would do. This was my second pair I purchased so of course I would recommend this product. I live in Michigan where you need a strong, waterproof, and insulated glove to stay warm and dry for that hard winter season we have. It's worth the money believe me okay?
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Coville

customer_reviews.title: Good pair of gloves, but hard to get on.
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are waterproof as advertised. As others have mentioned, the openings are narrow and tight so getting your hands into the gloves is challenging. My right-hand glove is more difficult to put on than my left-hand glove. Perhaps over time the openings will slack up and the gloves will become easier to put on. The gloves keep my hands warm down to about 25-30 Fahrenheit. Below that, they can't keep up with the cold. I probably shouldn't be outside in that kind of weather anyway, I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: BuyerInLA

customer_reviews.title: I was generous giving 4-stars. Keeps my hands warm ...
customer_reviews.text: I was generous giving 4-stars. Keeps my hands warm but the liner has a tendency to pull out with your hands. If it wasn't for that, these gloves would have received 5-stars.
customer_reviews.author: G. Foreman

customer_reviews.title: Warm and useful
customer_reviews.text: Winter got pretty brutal cold at times here in buffalo. These gloves were fantastic. They kept me warm, they kept me dry, and whether shoveling or salting or scraping off the car... or on the few occasions I had to be outdoors for very extended periods of time, they were fantastic, and I'm very glad I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Not warm for cold hands
customer_reviews.text: I had to return these gloves. I bought them because I was traveling to Alaska during winter, hoping they'd protect my hands from the cold. Although they are waterproof and I could play in the snow, they are not very warm inside. So, when my hands were cold and I put them in the gloves, they felt cold inside and they remained so for a long time. I was surprised to find that when I removed the gloves and put my hands in my pockets (Down jacket), they felt warm and stayed that way.
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: Warm and great price
customer_reviews.text: Took on a recent snow tubing trip. Very very warm and price is great compared to other name brand gloves. My only con is that due to the liner not being attached, if you take gloves on and off and are a little sweaty, sometimes some of the fingers would not extend properly back into the glove and would cram your fingers up. On the whole, great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Holt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: Warm and comfy. Fits perfectly. It was cold here when I ordered it but it's warm now. Can't wait for snow and some cold weather to try them out. Gloves are really nice and Carhartt products are top of the line. I can always trust that product.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Lew

customer_reviews.title: Great for the cold
customer_reviews.text: I have used these gloves numerous times while shoveling snow or running my snow blower. Very good fit and hands always stay warm. However, if taken off, they are hard to get back on with damp-ish hand but all other gloves behave the same.
customer_reviews.author: JimM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cold/wet weather work gloves
customer_reviews.text: Excellent work gloves for below freezing temps. Durable and keeps your hands warm even in wet, cold weather. The one problem I have is when the gloves get wet inside from “perspiration” it takes a LONG time to dry them out. At least 3 days...unless I put them in the dryer. Even then, it takes 2 or 3 dry cycles.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Gutschow

customer_reviews.title: Very warm gloves
customer_reviews.text: They definitely keep my hands warm which is most important to me. I have fairly large hands and they fit very well... once I get them on, but it isn't easy to get them on. I can't really say about there durability because I haven't used them long enough, but so far they have done very well. They also don't afford much grip when handling things. But as I said, most important to me they do keep my hands warm will working in a subzero freezer.
customer_reviews.author: Page G.

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: First time in ages I can say a pair of gloves exceeded my expectations. I use these to ride to work, and even at 32 they were almost too toasty. The liner sometimes gets pulled out of place when you withdraw your hand, making getting your hand back in annoying. However, I can't say how happy I am to have warm hands on my bike. Haven't tested the waterproofing, however, and likely won't.
customer_reviews.author: L. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Really nice waterproof winter gloves for yard work, driving, etc
customer_reviews.text: Really nice waterproof winter gloves for yard work, driving, etc. I bought these primarily for snow clearing my driveway. The fit was a bit snug getting my hand through the wrist part, and I have smaller than average hands. Something to consider if you have large hands or wrists maybe. Once on however, they are super comfortable including the fit around the wrist (which is probably a good thing to be snug, as it will help keep air and snow out). I already plan to buy a second pair to keep "nice", as I'll be using this first pair for snow clearing and outside work I expect to ding them up quickly, but that's OK.
customer_reviews.author: A. Newman

customer_reviews.title: My Gloves Froze!
customer_reviews.text: Where do I start. They sweat, they don't breath and they smell bad! they are a pain in the rear to put on when they're sweaty. Which is a lot. I took the gloves off while hiking in the snow, to let my hands dry off and while they were off, the gloves froze!!. Literally froze. I couldn't get them back on. I was upset to say the least. And did I mention they make your hands stink? Not happy with these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: wvu boy

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: These glove are not up to par with anything Else carhart I’ve owned. They are thick yeah BUT 2 minutes after putting them on in 20 degree weather btw my hands were sweating bad. They do not breathe what so ever and they star to stink FAST and when you wasH them they have to be put in the dryer multiple times because the inside won’t dry.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Durability n Fit... found here
customer_reviews.text: I pick out all my Husband's clothing, poor thing is color blind and believes he's still a medium, hes not. Hes 5'11 200lbs I ordered the xxl his hand opened is 9.5 inches, the glove was a perfect fit
customer_reviews.author: dia daze

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves for my son-in-law who works a night shift in Colorado. These waterproof gloves are perfect for him. I got him a size large and they fit perfectly. He said they kept him warm and dry all night working outside in the rain/snow. The lining is also very warm and soft. The velcro strap lets you fit to your needs.
customer_reviews.author: P. McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy these Carhartt gloves
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in these gloves. I have many Carhartt products and these are bad. I have worn them on 4 occasions to load firewood into my truck bed and the fingers on the left hand have worn through the fabric. I do not recommend these gloves for anything other than standing in the cold.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Super insulated. My hands were hot
customer_reviews.text: Five stars for keeping my hands warm, but really Four stars because my hands sweat like crazy in these. I used them snowboarding and they were too hot. I would recommend them for just wearing....not doing any activity with them.
customer_reviews.author: Shops2much

customer_reviews.title: Comfort &warmth
customer_reviews.text: Fit is as advertised. Very comfortable to wear. These were bought for my husband and he is picky but he wears them regularly. The only issue is that the cellphone finger does not really work because of the bulkiness of the glove
customer_reviews.author: Sally

product_meta.title: Carhartt Men's W.P. Waterproof Insulated Glove
product_meta.description:
The Carhartt WP Glove is waterproof and sweat wicking, keeping your hands warm and dry. Your hands are your tools. Protect them with the glove designed to outwork them all.




PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Product Dimensions :13 x 7 x 4 inches; 7.2 Ounces
 * Item model number :A511
 * Department :Mens
 * Date First Available :October 26, 2011
 * Manufacturer :Carhartt
 * ASIN :B005TIBCY6

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #7,551 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)  *  #54 inSafety Work Gloves 
    *  #8 inMen's Cold Weather Gloves 
    *  #4173 inMen's Shops 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.5 out of 5 stars5,099 ratings The Carhartt WP Glove is waterproof and sweat wicking, keeping your hands warm and dry. Your hands are your tools. Protect them with the glove designed to outwork them all.
feature_bullets: FastDry technology lining wicks away sweat for comfort
Spot wash by hand in luke warm water with mild detergent. Hang to dry. Do not use hot water. Do not put in dryer.
